parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party.  It focuses on a weather warning and safety advice.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a public Facebook post with paid promotion, targeting a wide geographical area in Romania (Botoșani County and surrounding areas), addressing the general public regarding road safety during adverse weather conditions.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about hazardous weather conditions and provide safety advice for drivers and pedestrians. There is no attempt to influence voting behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The content is presented in a journalistic style, providing factual information and safety recommendations. It resembles a public service announcement rather than political campaigning.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express personal opinions or viewpoints related to any political candidate or party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1145680126976634</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post is a public service announcement related to weather conditions and road safety in Botoșani County. It does not mention any political candidates, parties, or electoral issues. The content is factual and aims to inform the public, not to influence voting behavior.  The paid promotion simply increases the reach of this public safety message.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and is not in violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Botosani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
